title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Red Sox lost 4-1 against the Yankees at Fenway Park, managing only two hits.
Lucas Giolito allowed two runs over 5.2 innings but the Red Sox offense struggled with key players out.
The Red Sox committed three errors, and issues behind the plate contributed to the Yankees' scoring.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr. suffered a season-ending left quad injury during Washington Commanders' game against the Green Bay Packers.
Wise, 31, was attempting to block an extra point when he was injured and subsequently required surgery.
Wise joined the Commanders in March on a one-year, $3.25 million contract after eight seasons with the Patriots.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early may start for the Red Sox against the Athletics next week after an impressive MLB debut.
Early is Boston's No. 6 prospect and tied a team record with 11 strikeouts in his debut against the A's.
Manager Alex Cora is considering Early for Tuesday's series opener, but will make a decision by Sunday.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Scott Boras and Alex Bregman will decide on contract opt-out after the Red Sox's 2025 season ends.
Bregman signed a three-year, $120 million contract with potential opt-outs after 2025 and 2026 seasons.
Bregman, 31, has been impactful in Boston, batting .279 with 16 home runs in 2025 despite injury setbacks.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Only Murders in the Building' Season 5 with Steve Martin and Selena Gomez is streaming on Hulu.
'Warfare', co-directed by former Navy SEAL Ray Mendoza, is available on HBO Max.
Psychological thriller 'The Girlfriend' featuring Robin Wright is streaming on Prime Video.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Christian Gonzalez and Keion White are ruled out for Patriots' Week 2 game against the Miami Dolphins.
Gonzalez has been sidelined since July 28 with a hamstring injury; White is out due to illness.
Linebacker Marte Mapu and tackle Morgan Moses are questionable for the game in Miami.

title: With DC Terrell Williams out, who will be calling defensive plays for Patriots vs. Dolphins?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots inside linebackers coach Zak Kuhr will call defensive plays against the Dolphins with DC Terrell Williams unavailable.
Mike Vrabel expressed confidence in Kuhr's play-calling ability, citing his experience during spring practices and growth from past roles.
Kuhr has a history of coaching alongside Vrabel, starting at Ohio State, with prior offensive and defensive coaching experience.

title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant intends to plead guilty in a federal fraud case ahead of her scheduled trial.
She and her late husband were accused of defrauding donors to their nonprofit, Violence in Boston, for personal expenses.
The 27-count indictment includes wire fraud, mail fraud, and tax violations; she faces significant prison time and fines.

title: Here’s what we know about Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler Robinson, 22, was arrested on suspicion of shooting Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, facing multiple felony charges.
Robinson, a student at Dixie Technical College, has no prior criminal record and was not affiliated with a political party.
Family reported Robinson recently became more political, and messages linked him to the crime through discussions about obtaining a gun.

title: 7 things to know about a pivotal Red Sox-Yankees series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox host critical series against Yankees at Fenway, battling for top AL wild-card spot.
Boston leads season series 8-2 against New York; pitching rotations feature top starters this weekend.
Red Sox adjust roster, place Brennan Bernardino on injured list, call up Chris Murphy.
